intro: Scaevola fauriei, commonly known as the fairy fanflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its delicate, fan-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salty environments. It has small, narrow leaves and produces numerous small flowers arranged in clusters. Scaevola fauriei is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and resilience to harsh conditions.
